author: Kristian Winfield
title: Deron Williams, Mavericks talking buyout, and Cavaliers poised to capitalize
text:
The Dallas Mavericks and veteran point guard Deron Williams have moved forward with contract buyout negotiations, according to The Vertical’s Shams Charania .
The Mavericks have told Williams they will pay out the full remaining amount of the $10 million contract he signed in the offseason if a buyout is reached, according to ESPN.com’s Marc Stein .
If Dallas lets go of the 32-year-old guard, NBA.com’s David Aldridge reports Williams will work out a deal to join the Cleveland Cavaliers . The Utah Jazz and Atlanta Hawks are other teams interested in signing the veteran floor general, according to Charania.
Williams, a Dallas native, is averaging 13.1 points and 6.9 assists in 29 minutes per game with the Mavericks. But the team has pivoted toward developing Yogi Ferrell as its full-time point guard for the future.
The Mavericks (22-34) are far from competing for a championship at 12th in the Western Conference standings. Would Williams rather compete for a title than endure a rebuild in his hometown? Most likely, but nothing is official yet.
Williams projects to be a good fit behind Kyrie Irving in Cleveland, given LeBron James ’ public demands for the team to go after a “f——— playmaker ” via free agency or trade. The Cavaliers’ only reserve point guard is rookie Kay Felder .
Williams enjoyed the heydays of his NBA career as a pick-and-roll maestro under Jerry Sloan’s Utah Jazz, where he averaged 17.3 points and 9.1 assists across six seasons alongside Carlos Boozer. His career begun trending downward after a trade sent him to the Nets in 2011.
